brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts a table of information about I O S Access Control Lists. The column head-ers include Type of ACL, Sample ACL Command/Statement, and Purpose of Statement. The type of ACL's described are Standard, Extended, and Named.

Type of ACL: Standard
Sample ACL Command/Statement:
Router (config)# access-list 1 permit host 172.16.2.88
Purpose of statement:
Permits a specific IP address.

Type of ACL: Extended
Sample ACL Command/Statement:
Router (config)# access-list 100 deny tcp 172.16.2.0 0.0.0.255 any eq telnet
Purpose of statement:
Denies access from the 172.16.2.0 /24 subnet to any other host if they are attempting to use telnet.

Type of ACL: Named
Sample ACL Command/Statement:
Router (config)# IP access-list standard permit-IP
Router (config-ext-n ACL) # permit host 192.168.5.47
Purpose of statement:
Creates a standard access list named permit-IP
Allows access from IP address 192.168.5.47
The first command puts the router into N ACL sub-command mode
